lines.text: Do you think I'm out of my mind?
I'm hoping for the best sir!

[soon to be bride instructing her groom on the ceremony]
And then you just keep saying I do.
Until you're done!
I hate to disturb your digestion, but I got to tell you this. Yer cook is in the jug - J-A-I-L - jug!
There oughta be a law against parks... and benches... and him!
Say... can you buttle?
Just say I"ve gone fishing - for - fish.

[Talking on the phone]
I've just heard from him, Miss. He's fishing. Yes, Miss. Fishing for fish.
Tell me? Is that a butler or is that a wiseguy?
The dirty rat, he pulled a fast one on her and left her holding the bag. Poor kid.
Well, how a nice girl like you happened to get hooked up with a mug like that?
He isn't a mug.
Well, how he happen to sell you that bill of goods? How you happen to fall for him?
The Depression.
You know, I had a hunch you wasn't married. That's why I made a play for you. And I still think you're pretty swell.
You make it very difficult for me to stay, sir, unless you treat me like a cook.
Well, I don't want to treat you like a no cook. I want to treat you like you was a, well, like you was a Mrs. Rossini. Yes, I"m a proposing to you. When I make up my mind, I make it up fast.
Oh, you really don't mean that Mr. Rossini. I'm afraid your stomach's gotten the better of your heart.
Why should a guy like that pass himself off to me as a butler?
Because he's nuts! Or, maybe he wants to be near that tomato. You know some guys do very funny things when there's a lady in the case.
All the time he was fooling around with her, he's going to marry this pain-in-the-neck, heh?
Come on, stick 'em up, fancy pants.
Relax, Romeo. We're just gonna take you for a little ride.
Hello, Cookie. The Chief wants to see you in the living room. Toots sweet!

Well, of all the insane things, with the wedding a week away, he's fishing. Fishing, as long as I've known Jim Buchanan he's never been the slightest bit interested in fish. Why, he doesn't know a swordfish from a trout.
I'll see you tonight, won't I?
Oh, no. Not tonight.
Oh, why not? Let's, let's dine somewhere alone and talk.
Talk? About what?
About nothing. That's the whole idea. Or, maybe just walk in the park, hold hands and swing them.
Don't be boyish.
Oh, but where's the romance, the glow, the, I don't know, the silly, careless rapture that's supposed to go with the whole darn thing?
